name: Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor

reviews.text: This was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were spacious (we had a family room and a connecting room), it was very clean and well serviced by cleaning staff over the christmas and new year period. In addition, the breakfast is varied and of good value, it has a nice gym and a nice outdoor pool (the smaller one is heated). The beds were very comfortable. I hardly noticed anything from falling asleep to waking up. The shower is great and the bathroom is well stocked with towels and bath products. It has free wifi and the business center has free internet and a heavy duty printer. You don't have a lot of staff assistance for minor things like carrying your luggage and the domestic staff are sometimes too overly keen to clean your room, but for the price , and even if it was more expensive, it is definitely worth it, and we had a fantastic stay. We were able to use their bathroom scales to weigh our luggage and the location is also very good for most places from downtown to the airport.
reviews.title: Fantastic - My new best place to stay in Houston

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic. It was our first stop on a 3700 mile road trip with the family (which consists of two young children). It really set the stage for a wonderful trip. Once you walk in, the lobby was very pretty, and the staff immediately greeted us and began the check-in process.
reviews.title: Beautiful and clean

reviews.text: The room was large, and very clean. The linens on the sheets were comfortable. It was quiet enough that I was able to get a couple hours of sleep in the middle of the day.
reviews.title: Excellent Christmas Party - The Hotel did a Wonderful Job!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really have nothing 'critical' to say about this hotel. A wonderful place, and definitely on our list for our next travel through Houston.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel & Service

reviews.text: We held the British School of Houston Christmas Party for parents and staff here. It was a great evening. Everything went smoothly, the food was even better than expected and we had no complaints.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a business conference or training venue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because this hotel was the 5th best hotel in the city. All I would say is if this is truly the 5th best, I wouldn't want to stay at any worse hotel than this one. Honestly, for the price, it was fine. We got this hotel for real cheap on a Saturday night. The staff was very nice and the hotel was fine. Nothing spectacular about it to earn a Top 5 rating. I always rely on tripadvisor to tell me where I can stay in the nicest hotel for the best buck. This time I was let down. The rooms were average, the amenities were common and the location was fine. Nothing too nice to comment about. If you want to save some money...yeah, stay here. But don't expect any bells or whistles.
reviews.title: Just an average hotel
Nasty Pool....
reviews.text: Nice place.staff friendly but pool is nasty,has a debris and some animals inside.i wait for 4 hrs somebody to clean, but just i saw some maintenance guy check the water and walk around the pool and left.(happend day of the week.Friday) Guyyyyyy is SUMERRRR and kids like Pool.pay attention. Thank you angelica for you help.Nice Lady in front desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warning you can easily miss the turn off for this hotel due to poor signage. All the overpasses in the area can easily interfere with your GPS signal.
reviews.title: Even with a GPS you can get lost trying to find this hotel

reviews.text: When coming off the highway via Dairy Ashford, onto the Old Katy Freeway, we would recommend you look for the Holiday Inn Express sign as the Hilton Garden Inn sign sits low to the ground, is unlit and blocked by trees. You will be turning into this hotel as soon as you pass the Holiday Inn Express sign and a steak house. If you go past the Hummer sign and drive by a car dealership you have missed the entrance to this hotel.
reviews.title: Could not have asked for anything better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this hotel is very good. It is clean, quiet and safe. The beds are comfortable, but on the firmer side. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the air conditioning units are noisy especially if you are a lighter sleeper.
reviews.title: A very good choise

reviews.text: Based on reviews here at TripAdvisor, I booked this hotel initially for a week's stay, and ended up extending my lodging there for three weeks. The cleanliness, the friendly and professional staff, the good food, and the sound sleep every night was tremendously welcome. The exercise room is great, with lots of machines, and neat as a pin. The hotel is located just far enough from I-10 that road noise is not an issue. This will be my preferred place to stay for business on the west side of Houston, for certain!
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel (Hilton garden Inn, Houston Energy Corridor) is by far the most accomadating hotel in Houston. The people are very friendly and service is excellent.
reviews.title: Best Businessman's Hotel in Houston

reviews.text: I've stayed there well over 30 times in the last two years
reviews.title: Extremely nice, comfortable hotel - great value

reviews.text: I got the Hilton Garden Inn on a Priceline deal during a quick business trip to Houston. I've never stayed at a Hilton Garden-Inn, but had a great night at this Houston location. The HGI in general was extremely clean, very well decorated, and had a nice lobby and lounge and breakfast area. My room was huge, really huge, including the bathroom. Although it didn't have a couch, there was a nice desk area, along with a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. It was very functional and comfortable, and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: You have to leave home, stay here.
Good service...clean space... very welcoming
reviews.text: Sometimes the most resounding feedback is what you don't hear - and I never heard a single word of complaint from the members of our group. For my own experience, I saw that everything was in order from the get-go, your front desk people had all the reservation info quickly at hand (probably the fastest check in I've ever seen), the entire place esp including my room was spotless and the pool/hot tub were pristine. All personnel were pleasant and helpful. Overall, staying with you was a positive experience that I would gladly recommend to others, and your crisp arrangements were a big part of it.
I stayed in 3 'business' hotels in Houston and this was easily the best. Nothing fancy but big light comfortable room and bathroom. Would happily stay there again on future visits.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine. Comfortable stay

reviews.text: We chose to stay in this hotel based on the reviews. The beds were comfortable, the rooms and facilities were clean, the kids loved the pool and hot tub .... the pool was free-form and looked nicer than the itty bitty rectangular ones you normally see at most other Garden Inns.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but definitely NOT quiet due to Window AC unit

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the window mounted AC unit is very loud. Everytime it kicks in I would wake up so I just turned it off completely .... then it was extremely quiet! Maybe it was something specific to our room -- #203 -- not sure. Maybe I'm used to hotels that don't have window mounted units and this is normal loudness.
reviews.title: outstanding service, cleanliness of room, everything ! Also extremely quiet !

reviews.text: Other than the loud AC unit, everything else was great. The ladies working the breakfast and Ivy in front desk were all very professional and courteous.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the kids loved having the pool almost all to themselves for a couple of days.
reviews.title: The Hilton Garden Inn is friendly, luxurious, beds are super comfy and it won't break the bank!

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor Hotel Houston
description: Welcome to the Hilton Garden Inn Houston Energy Corridor hotel. Located on Houston's Westside in the Energy Corridor, the hotel is near shops, restaurants, and leading businesses. Many prominent oil, engineering, hi-tech and healthcare companies are minutes from the hotel including BP, ConocoPhillips, and Shell Oil. Enjoy easy access to Interstate 10 (Katy Freeway) and the Sam Houston Tollway. The hotel offers guests a complimentary shuttle service within a five-mile radius. Stay connected throughout your visit to Houston with complimentary high-speed internet access in all rooms and public areas of the hotel. Enjoy a thoughtful service at the hotel with our complimentary fitness center, swimming pool, and 24-hour Business Center. Relax with delicious cuisine at the restaurant or pick up a treat from the 24-hour Pavilion Pantry® to enjoy in the comfort of your guest room or suite. The hotel boasts more than 3000 sq. ft. of function space, ideal for various meetings and events from business conferences to cocktail parties and weddings.
